CDX Example

Two carbons bonded by a single bond and their calculated 13C NMR spectrum:

Download CBndCNMR.cdx

This is a listing showing the structure and contents of a CDX file which contains a pair of carbon atoms connected by a single bond with a text string and a computed NMR spectrum under them.

This CDX file has a top-level Document object which contains a bunch of properties ("Creating Program" through "MacPrintInfo") and a single object ("Page") with ID 1.'

The Page object contains three Text objects with IDs 5, 7 and 8, a Fragment object with ID 10, and a Spectrum object with ID 9.

Each Text object contains several properties ("Text" through "Front-to-back order") including the positioning information to place the two atom annotations "6.8" near the corresponding atoms..

The Fragment object contains two Node objects with IDs 2 and 3, and a Bond object with ID 4

Each Node object contains several properties ("Node Type" through "Node_LabelDisplay") and a Text object.

The Bond object contains two properties ("Begin & End node #s" through "Front-to-back order"). The "Begin & End node #s" property contains the IDs of the two Nodes connected by the Bond.

The Spectrum object with ID 9 contains properties ("X Spacing" through "BoundingBox").

------------------
